ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: What is your title in your law enforcement agency?
Notes: 1 = Chief of police; 2 = Sheriff; 3 = Deputy chief of police; 4 = Under-sheriff; 5 = Other

ElementDescription: If you title in your law enforcement agency is other, please describe.
Does your organization currently offer temporary firearm storage at the request of community members?
Has your organization ever offered temporary firearm storage at the request of community members (voluntary storage)?
Has your organization ever provided firearm storage when an individual is subject to a court order (e.g., Extreme Risk Protection Order/red flag or domestic violence protection order)?
How frequently did you receive requests for firearm storage in the past 12 months for any reason (whether or not you agreed to provide storage)?
Notes: 1 = More than 20 requests; 2 = 10-20 requests; 3 = 3-9 requests; 4 = 1-2 requests; 5 = No requests in the past 12 months but we have received at least one request in the past; 6 = We have never received a request

ElementDescription: If your agency has ever provided storage, select ''yes'' then please answer the following questions. If ''no'' you will be directed to the next questions.
Under what circumstances has your agency provided storage: Upon request?
Under what circumstances has your agency provided storage: Travel out of town?
Under what circumstances has your agency provided storage: Safety concerns/suicide concerns?
Under what circumstances has your agency provided storage: Prohibited individual is guest in the home?
Under what circumstances has your agency provided storage: Divorce?
Under what circumstances has your agency provided storage: Military deployment?
Under what circumstances has your agency provided storage: During addiction, medical or mental health treatment?
Under what circumstances has your agency provided storage: Relative who has passed away?
Under what circumstances has your agency provided storage: Moving?
Under what circumstances has your agency provided storage: Other?
If you selected Other for the circumstance in which your agency has provided storage, please describe.
How frequently did you agree to provide firearm storage?
Notes: 1 = Provided storage for all requests; 2 = Provided storage for more than half of requests; 3 = Provided storage for less than half of requests, but at least one

ElementDescription: Are there any circumstances in which you did not provide storage for someone who requested it: Not their firearm?
Are there any circumstances in which you did not provide storage for someone who requested it: Reason for storing not appropriate?
Are there any circumstances in which you did not provide storage for someone who requested it: Not enough storage space?
Are there any circumstances in which you did not provide storage for someone who requested it: Other?
If you selected Other for the circumstance in which you did not provide storage for someone who requested it, please describe.
If you provide storage due to court orders, is the storage and return process different for those cases when compared to voluntary storage?
Notes: 1 = Yes, we handle court-ordered storage differently from voluntary storage; 2 = No, they are handled the same; 3 = We do not provide both

ElementDescription: Has your agency ever declined to return a firearm that was being temporarily stored in your facility due to safety concerns?
